page.title: 08Our School
page.content: Our school is at the top of a hill just outside Rothbury and south of the river Coquet. It is named after the Reverend Doctor Thomlinson who founded a grammar school in 1720. Our school, which carries his name, was built just over twenty years ago.There are approximately 200 children in the school and about half of them travel in by bus from such places as Longframlington, Netherton, Alwinton and Harbottle. I live in Rothbury and I find it hard work climbing the hill some mornings. Some people climb a series of steps just over the bridge to get to school. We call these steps "Jacob's Ladder." Some people cross the stepping stones over the river on their way to school but this is not possible when there is flood water in.
